page.title: 11Pea selling,Holbeach Hurn.
page.content: Every year the village of Holbeach Hurn has a "pea sale".On each of two Saturday mornings in July the villagers turn out onto the playing field at about 8.30a.m.Waiting there will be a massive trailer load of freshly vined peas.These are then sold by the scoopful,each about 2lbs.The sale goes on until 1p.m.People come from all over the country to buy,and some people buy as many as 20 or more scoops.They bring all sorts of things to put the peas in,from carrier bags to plastic dustbins.In July 1985 a scoop cost 50p.There was also one Saturday morning selling peas on Spalding market.The peas come from local farmers who sell them to the village at discount price.They are washed and shelled for sale.The profits go towards buying things for the villagers and their hall.
